definition: to recover one's power or authority/restoration (of a past regime)
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter
to open (a door)/to open up (for development)/to dispel/to refute/to repudiate
Manchu Restoration of 1917, see 張勳復辟|张勋复辟[Zhanɡ1 Xun1 Fu4 bi4]
Manchu Restoration of 1917, an attempt by general 張勳|张勋[Zhanɡ1 Xun1] to reinstate the monarchy in China by restoring the abdicated emperor Puyi 溥儀|溥仪[Pu3 yi2] to the throne

sentences.english: The Restoration is an important transformable age in the history of finance and taxation in England .
sentences.chinese: 复辟时期是英国财政与税收史上的一个重要转型时代。

sentences.english: He became a faithful restoration dynasty pawns .
sentences.chinese: 他成了复辟王朝的忠实走卒。

sentences.english: They defeated Zhang Xun and put on end to this restoration farce.
sentences.chinese: 他们打败了张勋，结束了这场复辟丑剧。

sentences.english: Constitutions were written and discarded. Monarchs were toppled and restored.
sentences.chinese: 宪法几经废立，君主被推翻又复辟。

sentences.english: Lurking behind progress, though, are oldideas waiting to be reapplied.
sentences.chinese: 不过，进步的背后，隐藏着亟待复辟的旧观点。

sentences.english: Charles II of England lived here before the Restoration in 1660. Population, 118,662.
sentences.chinese: 英王查理二世在1660年复辟前居于此。

sentences.english: But the generals will surely do their damnedest to thwart a Thaksinite restoration.
sentences.chinese: 但将军们一定会尽他们最大的努力来阻止他信的复辟。

sentences.english: In 1660 the monarchy was restored under King Charles II.
sentences.chinese: 1660年，查尔斯二世复辟，英国恢复了君主制。

sentences.english: The voice of the people finally superseded the restoration trend of thought.
sentences.chinese: 人民的呼声终于战胜了复辟的思潮。

definition: Manchu Restoration of 1917, an attempt by general 張勳|张勋[Zhanɡ1 Xun1] to reinstate the monarchy in China by restoring the abdicated emperor Puyi 溥儀|溥仪[Pu3 yi2] to the throne
mutiny/(Tw) to be dumped by one's girlfriend while serving in the army
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
to go against the tide (idiom); to do things all wrong/to try to turn back history/a perverse way of doing things
